entry.long: Keep playing random songs after the playlist is empty.

entry.name: game/pitch

entry.name: game/theme
entry.long: Name of the theme to use.

entry.name: game/playlist_screen_timeout
entry.long: How long it will take before the next song in the playlist starts automatically.

entry.name: game/results_timeout
entry.long: How long the scores will be displayed for after finishing a song.

entry.name: game/highscore_timeout
entry.long: How long the high-scores screen will wait for input before going to the next song.

entry.name: game/webserver_access
entry.long: Define if you want to control performous remotely with web interface (requires restart).

entry.name: game/case-sorting
entry.long: Make a difference between uppercase and lowercase letters when sorting.

entry.name: game/webserver_port
entry.long: Port to use for the web server. Choose one that is not used by other applications.

entry.name: game/webserver_fallback_port
entry.long: Port to use in case original webserver port is in use. Choose one that you know for sure is not used by other applications.

entry.name: game/keyboard_guitar
entry.long: Enable keyboard as guitar (Frets on Fire mode).

entry.name: game/keyboard_drumkit
entry.long: Enable keyboard as drumkit.

entry.name: game/drum_promode
entry.long: Drums use Pro mode (toms are not cymbals)

entry.name: game/keyboard_dancepad
entry.long: Enable keyboard as dance pad.

entry.name: game/keyboard_keytar
entry.long: Enable keyboard as keytar.

entry.name: game/instrument0
entry.long: Override autodetection and force the first controller to the given type.

entry.name: game/instrument1
entry.long: Override autodetection and force the second controller to the given type.

entry.name: game/instrument2
entry.long: Override autodetection and force the third controller to the given type.

entry.name: game/instrument3
entry.long: Override autodetection and force the fourth controller to the given type.

entry.name: game/instruments
entry.long: Force joystick to some kind of instrument.

entry.name: game/midi_input
entry.long: Regex for matching the MIDI devices to use. The default is to use all available devices.

entry.name: game/sorting_ignore
entry.long: Words that should be ignored when sorting.

entry.name: graphic/window_width
entry.long: The width of the window.

entry.name: graphic/window_height
entry.long: The height of the window.

entry.name: graphic/window_pos_x
entry.long: The X-Position of the window.

entry.name: graphic/window_pos_y
entry.long: The Y-Position of the window.

entry.name: graphic/highdpi
entry.long: Enable High-DPI (Retina) graphics when supported; requires restart.

entry.name: graphic/fullscreen
entry.long: Enable fullscreen mode on startup.

entry.name: graphic/stereo3d
entry.long: Enable 3D rendering of Performous.

entry.name: graphic/stereo3dtype
entry.long: Some modes may only get activated in fullscreen mode.

entry.name: graphic/stereo3dseparation
entry.long: The strength of the effect. Experiment with different settings for best results.

entry.name: graphic/video
entry.long: Allows completely disabling background videos. It is recommended to leave this enabled as Performous will still smoothly fade out the video if your computer is not fast enough.

entry.name: graphic/webcam
entry.long: Performous can use webcam as a background video. Disable it if Performous crashes while entering a song.

entry.name: graphic/webcamid
entry.long: Use -1 to autodetect or a number starting from 0 to choose specific device.

entry.name: graphic/svg_lod
entry.long: Larger numbers cause vector graphics to be rendered in higher resolution. Decrease this to make navigating in menus faster.

entry.name: graphic/text_lod
entry.long: Larger numbers cause text to be rendered in higher resolution. Decrease this to make everything a little faster.

entry.name: graphic/fps
entry.long: Framerate limit of 100 FPS is removed and the game instead renders at full speed. FPS values are printed to console. Please note that the display drivers may still limit the rendering speed to the screen refresh rate.

entry.name: audio/latency
entry.long: This is a hint for the audio engine about the desired latency. Set this as low as possible while retaining clear audio playback. Requires restart.

entry.name: audio/backend
entry.long: Configure which audio backend to use; not all backends will be supported on all platforms.

entry.name: audio/video_delay
entry.long: Affects all modes. Use negative value if your display input lag is greater than the sound card output latency, positive values in the opposite case and zero if they are equal. This should be set so that the notes pass the cursor at the same time the audio is heard. Use Ctrl+F1/F2 to adjust this while performing.

entry.name: audio/round-trip
entry.long: Affects singing only. The time it takes for Performous playback to reach your speakers, fly to the microphone and all the way back until Performous captures and analyzes it. While performing, press Ctrl+S for synth mode and adjust with Ctrl+F3/F4.

entry.name: audio/controller_delay
entry.long: Affects instruments and dancing only. The total of USB (guitar or dance pad) latency combined with audio output latency. Adjust so that you can hit the notes best when playing by ear (not looking on screen). Use Ctrl+F5/F6 to adjust while performing.

entry.name: audio/devices
entry.long: List of audio devices to try.

entry.name: audio/preview_volume
entry.long: The volume level of menus, song previews and jukebox mode.

entry.name: audio/music_volume
entry.long: The ingame music volume. Values above 90 are not recommended as distortion may occur.

entry.name: audio/fail_volume
entry.long: The ingame fail sound volume. Values above 90 are not recommended as distortion may occur. 11 is louder than 10, but these go to 100. 89 louder!

entry.name: audio/pass-through
entry.long: Send captured singing voice to speakers.

entry.name: audio/pass-through_ratio
entry.long: How much voice is amplified compared to the music.

entry.name: audio/suppress_center_channel
entry.long: Suppress audio of center channel (e.g. vocals).

entry.name: paths/songs
entry.long: Where to recursively look for songs. DATADIR at the beginning means all Performous data folders.

entry.name: paths/showhiddenfolders
entry.long: When true the screen_paths will also show hidden folders

entry.name: paths/system-songs
entry.long: Where to recursively look for songs. DATADIR at the beginning means all Performous data folders.

entry.name: paths/system
entry.long: System defaults are included automatically. Additional paths can be added here.
